definitions.text: the manner in which something fits
examples: I admired the fit of her coat

definitions.text: a sudden flurry of activity (often for no obvious reason)
be the right size or shape; fit correctly or as desired
examples: This piece won't fit into the puzzle
Does this paper meet the requirements for the degree?
He fitted other pieces of paper to his cut-out

definitions.text: insert or adjust several objects or people
examples: Can you fit the toy into the box?
This man can't fit himself into our work environment

definitions.text: be compatible, similar or consistent; coincide in their characteristics
examples: The two stories don't agree in many details
The handwriting checks with the signature on the check
The suspect's fingerprints don't match those on the gun

definitions.text: conform to some shape or size
provide with (something) usually for a specific purpose
examples: The expedition was equipped with proper clothing, food, and other necessities

definitions.text: meeting adequate standards for a purpose
examples: it is fit and proper that you be there
do as you see fit to

definitions.text: (usually followed by `to' or `for') on the point of or strongly disposed
examples: in no fit state to continue
we are set to go at any time

definitions.text: physically and mentally sound or healthy
examples: felt relaxed and fit after their holiday
keeps fit with diet and exercise
